reviews.review: Fun game with friends. I'm glad they're frequently updating it. Now it's time to fix the broken killers and stop buffing them.

Played this game since 2017 and I can say that it is my favorite game right now. The game play can be inconsistent and the game has a lot of issues currently. Mainly with survivor queue times and disconnects, the devs already enabled a dc penalty so this issue is solved for the most part. However the survivor queue times is what really makes this game a 9 instead of a 10 for me, it takes me about 5 minutes to get into a survivor game. This then shifts me into playing more of killer which is really fun, but it can get boring if you play too much. This stems from the matchmaking system matching high rank killers with survive with friends groups. for example, say you are playing with your friends who are ranks 10,15, and 19 (you are a rank 3). The matchmaking system will pick the highest rank and put it into a queue for killers that are around rank 3. The previous system was when the matchmaking system averaged the ranks and you would be matched with a killer with the average rankings.  

This game may seem like it is full of issues, but there is not too many other big issues other than queue times in my opinion. The variety in this game is what separates this game from other games. There are 15 different killers with the addition of the gunslinger, all with different and unique powers. This gives you a grand amount of options to choose from, some people may enjoy Trapper or Wraith game play while others enjoy billy. The game offers many killer perks as well which you can make certain builds with. Another positive in this game is that the game play is unique and interactive. Depending on the structure the killer is chasing the survivor around he will have to change his strategy if he wants to catch them. For example if the killer is chasing a survivor around a L wall T wall structure with two windows he will have to run it a specific way to catch the survivor. Also on the survivor side there is a lot of predicting and mind games at play when you are at a jungle gym and you have to predict what the killer will do to counter act it. 

Some people may also say that gen speeds are quick which I agree to an extent. I think that people relied too much on ruin instead of getting normal pressure by getting quick down. This artificial pressure with ruin is now gone so it seems that gens are getting done fast, but if you get enough pressure you should win a good deal of games as killer.

How Strong are the Killers?
Trapper
Pros: traps are useful in removing strong tiles
Cons: lacks mobility and setting down traps takes a while 
Overall: 5/10

Wraith
Pros: cloaking is useful in sneaking up on oblivious survivors and cloaking has good mobility
Cons: His power doesn't help in chase so it can be difficult to catch experienced survivors
Overall: 6/10

Billy (favorite)
Pros: amazing mobility and he has one shot potential
Cons:good survivors can still loop billys for long periods. also can be hard to learn
Overall: 9/10

Nurse
Pros: amazing mobility, can down survivors very quickly, and good survivors are as vulnerable to the nurse as decent survivors
Cons: can take some time to learn other than that none
Overall: 10/10

Huntress
Pros: fps players will love this killer, can down survivors very quickly with her hatchets, she can also make some structures impossible to loop, good snowball potential
Cons: slow, has to reload every time she throws five hatchets, 
Overall: 9/10

The Shape (aka shirtless boi)
pros: great stealth, very fun to play, he's michael fucking myers,also he has an insta down
Cons: slow at the beginning of the game which can leave you in a tough spot, insta down has to be charged up to be used, 
Overall: 7/10

The Hag 
Pros: great camping potential, can neutralize certain areas, solid in chases
Cons: not fun to play (imo), slow and frustrating, no mobility, 
Overall: 7.5/10 (I would put her lower if it was rated by enjoyment)

 The Doctor
Pros: Great in chase, can also find survivors easily which can be useful if the survivors are stealthy, power can waste some of the survivors time
Cons: Not much mobility
Overall: 8.5/10

The Cannibal
Pros: ummm he can camp the basement with insidious, one shot down, can face camp 
Cons: little mobility, terrible chase potential, 
Overall: 2/10

The Nightmare
Pros: good gen slow down, solid chase potential with fake pallets or dream snares, good mobility with gen teleport
cons: even with the dream snares or fake pallets his chase potential can be hit or miss (especially fake pallets)
Overall: 8/10

The Pig (one of my favorites)
Pros: crouching can help in chase along with sneaking up to people,her RBT's are hit or miss but a decent slow down
Cons: little mobility (even slower if you crouch), power can help in certain situations in chase  but some areas are tough to deal with
Overall: 7.5/10

The Clown
pros: power is literally designed for limiting pallet looping
cons: if survivors just pre throw pallets and do gens clown will lose a lot of the time, little mobility,
Overall: 6.5/10

The Spirit
pros: second best down potential in the game, decent mobility, good survivors have trouble 
cons: slow(when not using her power), can be kinda hard to learn, but not as hard as billy or nurse
Overall: 9.5/10

The Legion
pros: his power can buy some time, easy first hit in chase
cons:after the first hit it can be hard to catch survivors, also his power is rechargeable, little mobility if you're using his power in chase 
Overall: 3.5/10

The Plague
pros: if survivors don't cleanse they are injured for the entire game, if they do you can down them easily, can buy some time if survivors cleanse
cons: if survivors don't cleanse it can be hard to keep pressure up, even with them being injured, if they do cleanse then you have to go where they cleansed to get your power which can take a lot of time
Overall: 5.5/10

The Ghost Face (one of the more underrated killers)
pros: arguably best stealth in the game, can immediately one shot down if he stalks a survivor, also he can have good snowball if multiple people are stalked, he can tbag
cons:no mobility, the power has to recharge 
Overall: 8/10

The Demogorgon (one of my favorites)
pros: great mobility with portals, his lunge can be used to end chases quickly, also has some tracking potential
cons: The portals take time to put down and can be destroyed
Overall:8/10

The Oni
pros: good mobility when he has his power, good snowball potential, decent in chase with his power, has one shots with his power
cons: power has to be recharged by hitting survivors and collecting blood, this mean about half of the game he will be a m1 killer
Overall:8/10

Bueno tiempo jugando y esta es mi OPINION!

- El juego por si, es interesante entretenido jugar en amigos es mucho mejor.
- Ya es hora de pensar en los sobreviviente no en darle velocidad si no mejorar algunas habilidades que son interesante pero a la hora de la verdad es puro NOMBRE.
pongo como ejemplo a AGILIDAD habilidad de Fe ming 
pasar corriendo una ventana o pallet haces un sprint de 150% mas de velocidad durante 3 seg ( no es nada ) pero este no es el caso seria bueno que tuviera un efecto secundario como caida equilibrada, puede ser: pasa la ventana un X % mas rapido igual que los pallet. esto seria un balance en la habilidad

por su parte el killer tiene desconcierto te hace saltar ventanas un % mas rapido y te bloquea la ventana X segundos

con esto te das cuenta que jugar sobreviviente, es mas dificil y entretenido.
no dire que esta desbalanceado o no cada cual tiene su opinion sobre el balance

Fun game but the game is just full of annoying design choices.

SURVIVOR REVIEW:
As a person who hates to be abused by unfair AI while playing a horror game. This game is perfect for me to be honest playing survivor is fun it also gets repetitive if you have a good squad and they is only a couple broken survivors (im looking at you Claudette). And the survivor mode is alright with friends you will have a hearty laugh for the first hour but after that you will start taking the game so less seriously when you learn how to counter the killers whether it be by insidious looping around pallets, or whether it just be making the killer chase you for about seven minuets because the killer's are so slow and you use a system to unlock perks called the bloodweb which is randomly generated every level which means you and your friend can be playing the same survivor but you will both be getting different perks which is beneficial and also you will get offerings which most of the time give you extra bloodpoints which is cool but they also give add-ons and items and at increments of 5 levels you will be unlocking perk slots to allow greater survivability. But the reason survivors are fun is how unique every survivor is some specialize in healing others specialize in risky gameplay its about the style you wanna play.

KILLER REVIEW:

Remember what i said about unfair AI? Well in this game you can play as a killer and murder everyone while almost being unstoppable (Pallets and looping aside). The killer aspect of the game is the best part of the game in my humble opinion finding survivors and killing them is so damn fun watching them try to find a pallet to stop you and then hitting them just before they can press the action button is hilarious and then watching as their friends attempt to save their friends in the basement which has dire consequences upon any survivor using the basement. My favorite killer in the game currently is The Legion not because they are broken, Or not because of their backstory (The backstory is nice). But i like them because its not a cliche killer they are an average sized human and not possesed or covered in mud or throws hatchets because they have an uncanny need to snipe people. No The Legion is just a group of 19 year olds who preforms acts of violence and honestly i love this they are so fun to play and their perks are crazy.

Buy The Game when it goes on sale.
Play with friends if you like them.
KILL OR BE KILLED.
Its a good game overall no matter if you like to play survivors or killer.

TL;DR Pretty good game overall, but bring a salt shaker.

The game is fleshed out to most degree involving what it wants to do with itself. It has a simple goal and does its job well. Where things get complicated is it's balancing. It has a horendious amount of skills ranging from powerful and meta-grade to completely pointless. Combinations of which turn even the worst player into a god among men regarding killers.

The killers are some of the best fun you will have, and mostly due to the fact that after dying to them 100 times the occasional play of them makes you feel the rush of having killed those other players that screwed up the generator 50 times in one go. 

Playing the survivors is like hoping the other 3 players are not braindead lunatics or those special "Meta Monsters" who want to farm bloodpoints by breaking generators to fix them and being chased for the entire game just to ditch the monster on you so you can die in their place. 

I won't even try to talk about the toxicity of the community....
